com.yantra.api.ycm

Interface receiveItemChanges

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCMApi, YIFApi

    public interface receiveItemChanges

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document receiveItemChanges(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The receiveItemChanges API is used to receive item changes from an external system and invoke the logic of the manageItem API internally.

    • Method Detail

      • receiveItemChanges

        org.w3c.dom.Document receiveItemChanges(YFSEnvironment env,
                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                        java.rmi.RemoteException

        The receiveItemChanges API is used to receive item changes from an external system and invoke the logic of the manageItem API internally. See the manageItem API for more information. The receiveItemChanges API can also handle conflict resolution. If the input XML contains RemoteModifyTS that is lesser than MaxModifyTs or RemoteModifyTS of the local item, then the item will not be modified and the ON_SYNC_FAILURE event will be raised.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        See the list of user exits of the manageItem API for more information.

        Events Raised:

        ON_SYNC_FAILURE:

          This event is raised a conflict is detected when RemoteModifyTS in the input XML is lesser than MaxModifyTs or RemoteModifyTS of the local item.
          Key Data: None
          Data Published: YCM_ITEM_DEFINITION_ON_SYNC_FAILURE.html
          Template Support: No

        Also see the list of events of the manageItem API for more information.

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML that contains details of an item. No output will be returned when item is deleted or conflict is detected. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
